alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Poweshiek; Tama (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 08 at 3:20AM CST until March 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Winter Storm Expected Portions of Northern and Central Iowa on Thursday into Thursday Night... .A storm is expected to spread precipitation into Iowa toward daybreak on Thursday. The precipitation is expected to expand statewide during the day with rain in the far south, rain and snow mixed in portions of southern and central Iowa and mainly snow across the north half of the state. Moderate to heavy snow accumulations are expected in the watch area by Thursday night. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches possible. Patchy blowing snow may also occur during the day Thursday. * WHERE...Portions of central Iowa. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be problematic. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
